snippet: The 2012 primary campaign has been by far the most volatile on record, but Mitt Romney and Ron Paul’s strong field operations have helped them avoid the polling swings of their rivals.
abstract: The 2012 primary campaign has been by far the most volatile on record, but Mitt Romney and Ron Paul’s strong field operations have helped them avoid the polling swings of their rivals.

byline.original: By NATE SILVER and MICAH COHEN

headline.print_headline: Ground Game Can Firm Up a Candidate’s Footing
